text: Agonum marginatum is a species of ground beetle in the Platyninae subfamily. It was described by Carl Linnaeus in 1758 and is found throughout Europe, North Africa, Siberia, West Asia, as well as on islands such as Canary, Azores, and Madeira. ==References== Category:Beetles described in 1758 Category:Beetles of Asia Category:Beetles of North Africa Category:Beetles of Europe marginatum Category:Taxa named by Carl Linnaeus
title: Agonum marginatum
